ch.ethz.rtc.kernel
Class Curve

java.lang.Object
  ch.ethz.rtc.kernel.Curve
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class Curve
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable

Curve represents a piecewise linear curve.

Since:
Version:
$Id: Curve.java 942 2010-07-26 11:39:35Z psimon $

Ernesto Wandeler

Curve

public Curve(SegmentList aperSegments,
             SegmentList perSegments,
             double px0,
             double py0,
             long period,
             double pdy,
             java.lang.String name)
Constructs a Curve with an aperiodic and a periodic part.

Parameters:
aperSegments - the segments of the aperiodic part.
perSegments - the segments of the periodic part.
px0 - the x-value of the start point of the periodic part.
py0 - the y-value of the start point of the periodic part.
period - the period of the periodic part.
pdy - the y-offset between periods of the periodic part.
name - the name of the curve.

Curve

public Curve(java.lang.String str)
Constructs a Curve from a textual representation. The textual representation equals the syntax that is used in Matlab to create a Curve. Any of the following forms works:

 name = Curve(aper, per, px0, py0, period, pdy, 'name') 
 name = Curve(aper, per, px0, py0, period, pdy) 
 name = Curve(aper, per, px0, py0, period, 'name') 
 name = Curve(aper, per, px0, py0, period) 
 name = Curve(per, py0, period, pdy, 'name') 
 name = Curve(per, py0, period, pdy) 
 name = Curve(per, py0, period, 'name') 
 name = Curve(per, py0, period) 
 name = Curve(per, period, 'name') 
 name = Curve(per, period)
 name = Curve(aper, 'name') 
 name = Curve(aper)


Additionally, any of the above string without "name = " works, e.g.:

 Curve(aper, per, px0, py0, period, pdy, 'name')


If name is defined at the left side of the equal sign, as well as in the method call, then the value in the method call is taken.

Parameters:
str - the textural representation of the Curve.

aperiodicSegments

public SegmentList aperiodicSegments()
Returns the segments of the aperiodic part of this curve as an SegmentList. Returns null if this curve does not contain an aperiodic part.

Returns:
the segments of the aperiodic part of this curve.

periodicSegments

public SegmentList periodicSegments()
Returns the segments of the periodic part of this curve as an SegmentList. Returns null if this curve does not contain an periodic part.

Returns:
the segments of the periodic part of this curve.

segmentsLEQ

public SegmentList segmentsLEQ(double xMax)
Returns the segments that define this Curve from 0 <= x <= xMax as a SegmentList.

Parameters:
xMax - the upper x-value up to which the segments of this Curve are returned.
Returns:
the segments of this Curve from 0 <= x <= xMax

segmentsLT

public SegmentList segmentsLT(double xMax)
Returns the segments that define this Curve from 0 <= x < xMax as a SegmentList.

Parameters:
xMax - the upper x-value up to which the segments of this Curve are returned.
Returns:
the segments of this Curve from 0 <= x < xMax

period

public long period()
Returns the period of the periodic part of this curve. Returns 0 if this curve does not contain a periodic part.

Returns:
the period of the periodic part.

px0

public double px0()
Returns the x-coordinate where the periodic part of this curve starts. Returns Double.NaN if this curve does not contain a periodic part.

Returns:
the x-coordinate where the periodic part of this curve starts.

py0

public double py0()
Returns the y-coordinate where the periodic part of this curve starts. Returns Double.NaN if this curve does not contain a periodic part.

Returns:
the y-coordinate where the periodic part of this curve starts.

pdx

public double pdx()
Returns the delta on the x-axis between two consecutive repetitions of the periodic part, i.e. the period itself. Returns Double.NaN if this curve does not contain a periodic part.

Returns:
the delta on the x-axis between two consecutive repetitions of the periodic part.

pdy

public double pdy()
Returns the delta on the y-axis between two consecutive repetitions of the periodic part, i.e. the offset. Returns Double.NaN if this curve does not contain a periodic part.

Returns:
the delta on the y-axis between two consecutive repetitions of the periodic part.

pds

public double pds()
Returns the overall slope of the periodic part: pds = pdy / pdx. Returns Double.NaN if this curve does not contain a periodic part.

Returns:
the overall slope of the periodic part.

pyMin

public double pyMin()
Returns the minimum y-value of the periodic part within x = [0,pdx] in the relative coordinate system with origin (px0/py0). Returns Double.NaN if this curve does not contain a periodic part.

Returns:
the minimum y-value of the periodic part.

pyMax

public double pyMax()
Returns the maximum y-value of the periodic part within x = [0,pdx] in the relative coordinate system with origin (px0/py0). Returns Double.NaN if this curve does not contain a periodic part.

Returns:
the maximum y-value of the periodic part.

y0epsilon

public double y0epsilon()
Returns the y-value of this curve at x = 0 + epsilon. I.e. if this curve is not continuous at x = 0, then the value at the right side of the discontinuity is returned.

Returns:
the y-value of this curve at x = 0 + epsilon.

yAtInfinity

public double yAtInfinity()
Returns the y-value of this curve at x = +infinity.

Returns:
the y-value of this curve at x = +infinitiy.

yXPlusEpsilon

public double yXPlusEpsilon(double x1)
Returns the y-value of this curve at x = x1 + epsilon. I.e. if this curve is not continuous at x = x1, then the value at the right side of the discontinuity is returned. It will return 0 if x1 < 0.

Parameters:
x1 - - the x-value at which we want to evaluate the function
Returns:
the y-value of this curve at x = x1 + epsilon.

yXMinusEpsilon

public double yXMinusEpsilon(double x1)
Returns the y-value of this curve at x = x1 - epsilon. I.e. if this curve is not continuous at x = x1, then the value at the left side of the discontinuity is returned. It will return 0 if x1 <= 0.

Parameters:
x1 - - the x-value at which we want to evaluate the function
Returns:
the y-value of this curve at x = x1 - epsilon.

definitionRange

public double definitionRange()
Returns the length of the definition range of this curve. For a purely aperiodic curve, the definition range is defined from 0 up to the x-value of the start point of the last curve segment. For a curve with a periodic part, the definition range is defined from 0 up to (px0 + pdx).

Returns:
the length of the definition range of this curve.

segmentIterator

public CurveSegmentIterator segmentIterator()
Returns a CurveSegmentIterator for this Curve.

Returns:
a CurveSegmentIterator for this Curve.

segmentIterator

public CurveSegmentIterator segmentIterator(double xMax)
Returns a CurveSegmentIterator for this Curve up to x < xMax.

Parameters:
xMax - the maximum value up to which to iterate.
Returns:
a CurveSegmentIterator for this Curve.

public CurveSubSegmentIterator subSegmentIterator(Curve c)
Returns a SubSegmentIterator for this Curve and c.

a SubSegmentIterator for this curve and c.

public boolean hasAperiodicPart()
Returns true if this curve has an aperiodic part.

Returns:
true if this curve has an aperiodic curve.

hasPeriodicPart

public boolean hasPeriodicPart()
Returns true if this curve has a periodic part.

Returns:
true if this curve has a periodic part.

isConstant

public boolean isConstant()
Returns true, if this Curve represents a constant. I.e. the Curve consists of a single Segment with slope=0.

Returns:
true, if this Curve represents a constant.

lowerBound

public Segment lowerBound()
Returns a lower bound to this curve as a Segment. The returned bound is valid from x = [start-point of returned segment] up to x = infinity.

Returns:
a lower bound to this curve.

upperBound

public Segment upperBound()
Returns an upper bound to this curve as a Segment. The returned bound is valid from x = [start-point of returned segment] up to x = infinity.

Returns:
an upper bound to this curve.

tightLowerBound

public Segment tightLowerBound()
Returns a tight lower bound to this curve as a Segment. The returned bound is valid from x = [start-point of returned segment] up to x = infinity.

Returns:
a tight lower bound to this curve.

tightUpperBound

public Segment tightUpperBound()
Returns a tight upper bound to this curve as a Segment. The returned bound is valid from x = [start-point of returned segment] up to x = infinity.

Returns:
a tight upper bound to this curve.

scaleX

public void scaleX(double factor)
Scale this curve along the x-axis.

Parameters:
factor - the factor to scale this curve.

scaleY

public void scaleY(double factor)
Scale this curve along the y-axis.

Parameters:
factor - the factor to scale this curve.

move

public void move(double dx,
                 double dy)
Move this Curve by (dx,dy). If dx is positive, a segment (0,0,0) is added at the beginning of the curve. If dx is negative, the resulting curve part defined over x < 0 is lost.

Parameters:
dx - the x-value by which this curve is moved.
dy - the y-value by which this curve is moved.

simplify

public void simplify()
Simplify this curve.

round

public void round()
Round all points that define this Curve. This includes all start points of all segments, all slopes, as well as px0, py0, pdy. All related values such as pds, pyMin and pyMax are newly calculated.

clone

public Curve clone()
Creates a deep copy of this Curve.

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a deep copy of this Curve.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
Returns true, if object quantitatively equals this curve. I.e. the name is not checked for equality.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
object - the Curve to compare this one with.
Returns:
true if this Curve equals object.

a String representation of this Curve.

toMatlabString

public java.lang.String toMatlabString()
Returns the data of this Curve in a textual form for export. The syntax is such that this String can be copied directly into Matlab to create a copy of this Curve.

Returns:
the data of this Curve in a textual form for export.
